zone.line: Chap. 17
It was eight o'clock when we landed; we
walked ‸ for a short time on the shore enjoying the transitory
twilight & then retired to the Inn and contem
plated the lovely scene of waters, mountains
& woods obscured in darkness yet still allow
ing their their darkblack outlines– The wind which
had fallen in the south now rose with great
violence in the west–the moon had
reached her summit in the heavens
& was beginning to descend the clouds
swept across it swifter than the
flight of the vulture and dimmed her
rays while the lake reflected the scene
of thebusy heavens ‸ m made still busier by the ‸ restless waves
that were beginning to rise– Suddenly
a heavy storm of rain descended.
It had been calm during the day but
now so soon as night ha obscured the shapes of
objects a thousand fears arose in
my mind – I was anxious and watchful
while my right hand grasped a pistol
which was hidden in my bosom –
Every sound terrified me, but I resoldved
that I would sell mys life dearly &
not die relax the conflict that impended untill my adversary layshould lie senseless at my

mod.add: my own life, or that of my adversary were extinguished

zone.line: Elizabeth observed my agitation for
some time in timid & fearful silence
At length she said – What is it, my dear
Victor, that agitates you? What is it
you fear?
Oh peace, peace, my love, I replied,
this night and all will be safe – but
this night is dreadful very dreadful.
